because as main D4 track it sucks big time compared to the mighty D3 theme that still rocks and puts you in the right mood for the game...

post.author: vertex007
post.body:
xalener wrote:
*listens to slow track. Liked it*
"Huh, I expect a lot of people are gonna have problems with this"
*goes to forums*

"HURR DURR IT WAS SLO AN BORIG EVEN THO I DUN NO DA FULL CONTIX AN REASNING BHIND SNG!!1!/1"

Ya'll are predictable.


as for the track, I'm not sure if it's legit. I like it, but I'm not sure.


no, I just don't like it, if you like it, fine....

I could also write..."oh its tha new doom track!!! must be good cause its id !!!!

title says theme song...as a main song it is weak and generic...I M O

DooM always had strong and original music, think E1M1....and that metal vibe...

sure you can say they want to make it different...I say fuck that ...build on the strength of the francise not against it ! and I really hope they are going to put more than 4 demons against you because in rage the 4 enemies at times fights are lame...
I don't want a pure remake but I want a DOOM game, worthy of its name and heritage, quick, brutal, scary and in your face.
and no console kiddies stuff...

really hope it is a fake and no theme song....

post.author: mth
post.body: 2 other leaked tracks sound waaaay better .

post.author: xalener
post.body:
vertex007 wrote:
think E1M1....and that metal vibe


Which this does have.

Quote:
oh its tha new doom track!!! must be good cause its id !!!!

Sure you could. You certainly aren't above it.

When I hear this, I think something like the looping main menu track. I mean if you heard Doom 3's menu music before you heard the actual theme, you'd say the same thing. However in retrospect you don't really think twice, do you?

The question is, where did this crop up from and why are people convinced it's legit? Seriously what's the history here?

post.author: mth
post.body: The guy uploaded tracks on his site: mick-gordon.com. He has unnanounced FPS in his credits. In show reel there are thumbs to each track, when you try to save them, the title is either "thumb.jpg" or "game name etc.jpg". On these tracks (there's three of them) title of the file is 'DOOM4_trackname_mastered".

post.author: xalener
post.body:
Well, fuck. That's pretty much all the proof one would ever need.

It also doesn't necessarily mean it's a main theme or even an important one though. If anything, it kinda feels like it was composed for a teaser trailer.

post.body: I asked Mick Gordon about that on his Twitter and he denied working on DOOM.
